definitions.definition: The act of swaying; a swaying motion; a swing or sweep of a weapon.

definitions.example: The old song caused a little sway in everyone in the room.

definitions.definition: Influence, weight, or authority that inclines to one side
definitions.example: I doubt I'll hold much sway with someone so powerful.

definitions.definition: Preponderance; turn or cast of balance.
A switch or rod used by thatchers to bind their work.
The maximum amplitude of a vehicle's lateral motion.
To move or swing from side to side; or backward and forward; to rock.
definitions.example: sway to the music;  The trees swayed in the breeze.

definitions.definition: To move or wield with the hand; to swing; to wield.
To influence or direct by power, authority, persuasion, or by moral force; to rule; to govern; to guide. Compare persuade.
definitions.example: Do you think you can sway their decision?

definitions.definition: To cause to incline or swing to one side, or backward and forward; to bias; to turn; to bend; warp.
definitions.example: reeds swayed by the wind;  judgment swayed by passion

definitions.definition: To hoist (a mast or yard) into position.
To be drawn to one side by weight or influence; to lean; to incline.
To bear sway; to rule; to govern.
